entities: United Nations Stabilization Mission in Haiti
reporting_cycle: semi-annually, not later than 45 days prior to its expiration
summary:
MINUSTAH's mandate includes supporting the Government's efforts to stabilize the country, promoting an all-inclusive political dialogue, and providing logistical and security assistance for the electoral process. 

The Council requests MINUSTAH to continue supporting the Haitian National Police (HNP) and to assist in the implementation of the HNP Reform Plan. 

The Council also invites Member States to engage with the Government of Haiti to address cross-border illicit trafficking and to contribute to strengthening HNP capacity. 

MINUSTAH's configuration will be maintained, with a military component of up to 7,060 troops and a police component of 2,091 police. 

The Council reaffirms its support for the Special Representative of the Secretary-General and his authority in coordinating UN activities in Haiti. 

The Council determines that the situation in Haiti continues to constitute a threat to international peace and security in the region. 

 Acting under Chapter VII of the Charter, it decides to extend MINUSTAH's mandate as previously defined in resolutions 1542 (2004), 1608 (2005), 1702 (2006), 1743 (2007), and 1780 (2007).
